titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham

did.abstract: Gertrude Vanderbilt-Smith's diary is housed in a single handwritten volume and spans the period 1855-1864. The diary is divided into two portions, the first of which contains written accounts of Smith's visits to friends in varying parts of New York State. These friends include Brooklyn figures such as John Ditmars, Henry Ditmars, George Fox, the Peet family, Vandervoorts, Lotts, and Schoonmakers.
